bible.derived: Masoretic Text, Greek New Testament of Erasmus, the Vulgate, and the Luther Bible.

translations.name: Great Bible
translations.description: The Great Bible is the first edition of the Bible in English to be authorized by King Henry VIII of England to be read aloud in Anglican Church services. Under the supervision of Thomas Cromwell, Myles Coverdale oversaw the translation. In 1538, Cromwell directed the clergy to provide \\\"one book of the bible of the largest volume in English, and the same set up in some convenient place within the said church that ye have care of, whereas your parishioners may most commodiously resort to the same and read it.\\\" It ended up being derived mostly from the Tyndale Bible which had been translated by William Tyndale who had been executed by Henry VIII for translating the Bible into English two years earlier.
